currentDoc:
How Worried Should We Be About Screen Time During the Pandemic?

The coronavirus pandemic ended the screen time debate: Screens won. We all now find ourselves on our screens for school, for work and for connecting with family and friends during this time of social distancing and increased isolation.

But should we be worried about this excessive screen use right now? Or should we finally get over it and embrace the benefits of our digital devices?

The coronavirus pandemic ended the screen time debate: Screens won. We all now find ourselves on our screens for school, for work and for connecting with family and friends during this time of social distancing and increased isolation.

The coronavirus pandemic ended the screen time debate: Screens won. We all now find ourselves on our screens for school, for work and for connecting with family and friends during this time of social distancing and increased isolation.

But should we be worried about this excessive screen use right now? Or should we finally get over it and embrace the benefits of our digital devices?

---

In my opinion, we must embrace the increased use for the time being but still be cautious of our usage. We still need to keep a balance, just less of one right now since so much of our lives can be run from home using all the different communication devices and services. 
IOverall though,  think we should embrace the benefits of our digital devices and use them to their fullest.

The coronavirus pandemic ended the screen time debate: Screens won. We all now find ourselves on our screens for school, for work and for connecting with family and friends during this time of social distancing and increased isolation.

But should we be worried about this excessive screen use right now? Or should we finally get over it and embrace the benefits of our digital devices?

---

In my opinion, we must embrace the increased use for the time being but still be cautious of our usage. We still need to keep a balance, just less of one right now since so much of our lives can be run from home using all the different communication devices and services. 
IOverall though,  think we should embrace the benefits of our digital devices and use them to their fullest.

But should we be worried about this excessive screen use right now? Or should we finally get over it and embrace the benefits of our digital devices?

---

In my opinion, we must embrace the increased use for the time being but still be cautious of our usage. We still need to keep a balance, just less of one right now since so much of our lives can be run from home using all the different communication devices and services. 
IOverall though,  think we should embrace the benefits of our digital devices and use them to their fullest.
 We must be very mindful of our children's but adults should probably try to be as productive as possible using these technologies. We just need to keep ourselves focused on our goals and limit our fun time if or when it starts to hurt our productivity and/or pe

The coronavirus pandemic ended the screen time debate: Screens won. We all now find ourselves on our screens for school, for work and for connecting with family and friends during this time of social distancing and increased isolation.

But should we be worried about this excessive screen use right now? Or should we finally get over it and embrace the benefits of our digital devices?

---

In my opinion, we must embrace the increased use for the time being but still be cautious of our usage. We still need to keep a balance, just less of one right now since so much of our lives can be run from home using all the different communication devices and services. 
IOverall though,  think we should embrace the benefits of our digital devices and use them to their fullest.
 We must be very mindful of our children's but adults should probably try to be as productive as possible using these technologies. We just need to keep ourselves focused on our goals and limit our fun time if or when it starts to hurt our productivity and/or personal relationships. We should also be using this time to explore new digital tools a

How Worried Should We Be About Screen Time During the Pandemic?

The coronavirus pandemic ended the screen time debate: Screens won. We all now find ourselves on our screens for school, for work and for connecting with family and friends during this time of social distancing and increased isolation.

But should we be worried about this excessive screen use right now? Or should we finally get over it and embrace the benefits of our digital devices?

---

In my opinion, we must embrace the increased use for the time being but still be cautious of our usage. We still need to keep a balance, just less of one right now since so much of our lives can be run from home using all the different communication devices and services. 
IOverall though,  think we should embrace the benefits of our digital devices and use them to their fullest.
 We must be very mindful of our children's but adults should probably try to be as productive as possible using these technologies. We just need to keep ourselves focused on our goals and limit our fun time if or when it starts to hurt our productivity and/or personal relationships. We should also be using this time to explore new digital tools and expand our skill sets. Screen time

How Worried Should We Be About Screen Time During the Pandemic?

The coronavirus pandemic ended the screen time debate: Screens won. We all now find ourselves on our screens for school, for work and for connecting with family and friends during this time of social distancing and increased isolation.

But should we be worried about this excessive screen use right now? Or should we finally get over it and embrace the benefits of our digital devices?

---

In my opinion, we must embrace the increased use for the time being but still be cautious of our usage. We still need to keep a balance, just less of one right now since so much of our lives can be run from home using all the different communication devices and services. 
IOverall though,  think we should embrace the benefits of our digital devices and use them to their fullest.

 We must be very mindful of our children's but adults should probably try to be as productive as possible using these technologies. We just need to keep ourselves focused on our goals and limit our fun time if or when it starts to hurt our productivity and/or personal relationships. Screen time in one form or another will eventually become an all day even connected using augmented reality  or virtual reality.

Screen time in one form or another will eventually become an all day even when we start using connecteaugmented reality  or virtual reality.

How Worried Should We Be About Screen Time During the Pandemic?

The coronavirus pandemic ended the screen time debate: Screens won. We all now find ourselves on our screens for school, for work and for connecting with family and friends during this time of social distancing and increased isolation.

But should we be worried about this excessive screen use right now? Or should we finally get over it and embrace the benefits of our digital devices?

---

In my opinion, we must embrace the increased use for the time being but still be cautious of our usage. We still need to keep a balance, just less of one right now since so much of our lives can be run from home using all the different communication devices and services. 
IOverall though,  think we should embrace the benefits of our digital devices and use them to their fullest.
 We must be very mindful of our children's but adults should probably try to be as productive as possible using these technologies. We just need to keep ourselves focused on our goals and limit our fun time if or when it starts to hurt our productivity and/or personal relationships. We should also be using this time to explore new digital tools and expand our skill sets. Screen time in one form or another will eventually become an all day even when we start using connectaugmented reality  or virtual reality.

The coronavirus pandemic ended the screen time debate: Screens won. We all now find ourselves on our screens for school, for work and for connecting with family and friends during this time of social distancing and increased isolation.

But should we be worried about this excessive screen use right now? Or should we finally get over it and embrace the benefits of our digital devices?

---

In my opinion, we must embrace the increased use for the time being but still be cautious of our usage. We still need to keep a balance, just less of one right now since so much of our lives can be run from home using all the different communication devices and services. 
IOverall though,  think we should embrace the benefits of our digital devices and use them to their fullest.
 We must be very mindful of our children's but adults should probably try to be as productive as possible using these technologies. We just need to keep ourselves focused on our goals and limit our fun time if or when it starts to hurt our productivity and/or personal relationships. We should also be using this time to explore new digital tools and expand our skill sets. Screen time in one form or another will eventually become an all day even when we start using augmented reality  or virtual reality. So, we should be trying to learn as much as possible about these technologies now and how they can be used to improve our lives. We should also be paying attention

But should we be worried about this excessive screen use right now? Or should we finally get over it and embrace the benefits of our digital devices?

---

In my opinion, we must embrace the increased use for the time being but still be cautious of our usage. We still need to keep a balance, just less of one right now since so much of our lives can be run from home using all the different communication devices and services. 
IOverall though,  think we should embrace the benefits of our digital devices and use them to their fullest.
 We must be very mindful of our children's but adults should probably try to be as productive as possible using these technologies. We just need to keep ourselves focused on our goals and limit our fun time if or when it starts to hurt our productivity and/or personal relationships. We should also be using this time to explore new digital tools and expand our skill sets. Screen time in one form or another will eventually become an all day even when we start using augmented reality  or virtual reality. So, we should be trying to learn as much as possible about these technologies now and how they can be used to improve our lives. We should also be paying attention to the opposite. What

How Worried Should We Be About Screen Time During the Pandemic?

The coronavirus pandemic ended the screen time debate: Screens won. We all now find ourselves on our screens for school, for work and for connecting with family and friends during this time of social distancing and increased isolation.

But should we be worried about this excessive screen use right now? Or should we finally get over it and embrace the benefits of our digital devices?

---

In my opinion, we must embrace the increased use for the time being but still be cautious of our usage. We still need to keep a balance, just less of one right now since so much of our lives can be run from home using all the different communication devices and services. 
IOverall though,  think we should embrace the benefits of our digital devices and use them to their fullest.
 We must be very mindful of our children's but adults should probably try to be as productive as possible using these technologies. We just need to keep ourselves focused on our goals and limit our fun time if or when it starts to hurt our productivity and/or personal relationships. We should also be using this time to explore new digital tools and expand our skill sets. Screen time in one form or another will eventually become an all day even when we start using augmented reality  or virtual reality. So, we should be trying to learn as much as possible about these technologies now and how they can be used to improve our lives. We should also be paying attention to the opposite. How Worried Should We Be About Screen Time During the Pandemic?

The coronavirus pandemic ended the screen time debate: Screens won. We all now find ourselves on our screens for school, for work and for connecting with family and friends during this time of social distancing and increased isolation.

But should we be worried about this excessive screen use right now? Or should we finally get over it and embrace the benefits of our digital devices?

---

In my opinion, we must embrace the increased use for the time being but still be cautious of our usage. We still need to keep a balance, just less of one right now since so much of our lives can be run from home using all the different communication devices and services. 
IOverall though,  think we should embrace the benefits of our digital devices and use them to their fullest.
 We must be very mindful of our children's but adults should probably try to be as productive as possible using these technologies. We just need to keep ourselves focused on our goals and limit our fun time if or when it starts to hurt our productivity and/or personal relationships. But should we be worried about this excessive screen use right now? Or should we finally get over it and embrace the benefits of our digital devices?

---

In my opinion, we must embrace the increased use for the time being but still be cautious of our usage. We still need to keep a balance, just less of one right now since so much of our lives can be run from home using all the different communication devices and services. 
IOverall though,  think we should embrace the benefits of our digital devices and use them to their fullest.
 We must be very mindful of our children's but adults should probably try to be as productive as possible using these technologies. We just need to keep ourselves focused on our goals and limit our fun time if or when it starts to hurt our productivity and/or personal relationships. We should also be using this time to explore new digital tools and expand our skill sets. Screen time in one form or another will eventually become an all day even when we start using augmented reality  or virtual reality. So, we should be trying to learn as much as possible about these technologies now and how they can be used to improve our lives. We should also be paying attention to the opposite. But should we be worried about this excessive screen use right now? Or should we finally get over it and embrace the benefits of our digital devices?

---

In my opinion, we must embrace the increased use for the time being but still be cautious of our usage. We still need to keep a balance, just less of one right now since so much of our lives can be run from home using all the different communication devices and services. 
IOverall though,  think we should embrace the benefits of our digital devices and use them to their fullest.
 We must be very mindful of our children's but adults should probably try to be as productive as possible using these technologies. We just need to keep ourselves focused on our goals and limit our fun time if or when it starts to hurt our productivity and/or personal relationships. We should also be using this time to explore new digital tools and expand our skill sets. Screen time in one form or another will eventually become an all day even when we start using augmented reality  or virtual reality. So, we should be trying to learn as much as possible about these technologies now and how they can be used to improve our lives. We should also be paying attention to the opposite. What is not working and how we can go about fixing it. Finally, it is my conclusion that adults should use this time to really engage with digital technolog

How Worried Should We Be About Screen Time During the Pandemic?

The coronavirus pandemic ended the screen time debate: Screens won. We all now find ourselves on our screens for school, for work and for connecting with family and friends during this time of social distancing and increased isolation.

But should we be worried about this excessive screen use right now? Or should we finally get over it and embrace the benefits of our digital devices?

---

In my opinion, we must embrace the increased use for the time being but still be cautious of our usage. We still need to keep a balance, just less of one right now since so much of our lives can be run from home using all the different communication devices and services. 
IOverall though,  think we should embrace the benefits of our digital devices and use them to their fullest.
 We must be very mindful of our children's but adults should probably try to be as productive as possible using these technologies. We just need to keep ourselves focused on our goals and limit our fun time if or when it starts to hurt our productivity and/or personal relationships. We just need to keep ourselves focused on our goals and limit our fun time if or when it starts to hurt our productivity and/or personal relationships. We should also be using this time to explore new digital tools and expand our skill sets. Screen time in one form or another will eventually become an all day even when we start using augmented reality  or virtual reality. So, we should be trying to learn as much as possible about these technologies now and how they can be used to improve our lives. We should also be paying attention to the opposite. What is not working and how we can go about fixing it. Finally, it is my conclusion that adults should use this time to really engage with digital technologies to learn what works and what does not. The coronavirus pandemic ended the screen time debate: Screens won. We all now find ourselves on our screens for school, for work and for connecting with family and friends during this time of social distancing and increased isolation.

But should we be worried about this excessive screen use right now? Or should we finally get over it and embrace the benefits of our digital devices?

IOverall though,  think we should embrace the benefits of our digital devices and use them to their fullest.
 We must be very mindful of our children's but adults should probably try to be as productive as possible using these technologies. We just need to keep ourselves focused on our goals and limit our fun time if or when it starts to hurt our productivity and/or personal relationships. We should also be using this time to explore new digital tools and expand our skill sets. Screen time in one form or another will eventually become an all day even when we start using augmented reality  or virtual reality. So, we should be trying to learn as much as possible about these technologies now and how they can be used to improve our lives. We should also be paying attention to the opposite. What is not working and how we can go about fixing it. Finally, it is my conclusion that adults should use this time to really engage with digital technologies to learn what works and what does not. How Worried Should We Be About Screen Time During the Pandemic?

The coronavirus pandemic ended the screen time debate: Screens won. We all now find ourselves on our screens for school, for work and for connecting with family and friends during this time of social distancing and increased isolation.

But should we be worried about this excessive screen use right now? Or should we finally get over it and embrace the benefits of our digital devices?

How Worried Should We Be About Screen Time During the Pandemic?

The coronavirus pandemic ended the screen time debate: Screens won. We all now find ourselves on our screens for school, for work and for connecting with family and friends during this time of social distancing and increased isolation.

But should we be worried about this excessive screen use right now? Or should we finally get over it and embrace the benefits of our digital devices?

---

In my opinion, we must embrace the increased use for the time being but still be cautious of our usage. We still need to keep a balance, just less of one right now since so much of our lives can be run from home using all the different communication devices and services. 
IOverall though,  think we should embrace the benefits of our digital devices and use them to their fullest.
 We must be very mindful of our children's but adults should probably try to be as productive as possible using these technologies. We just need to keep ourselves focused on our goals and limit our fun time if or when it starts to hurt our productivity and/or personal relationships. We should also be using this time to explore new digital tools and expand our skill sets. Screen time in one form or another will eventually become an all day even when we start using augmented reality  or virtual reality. So, we should be trying to learn as much as possible about these technologies now and how they can be used to improve our lives. We should also be paying attention to the opposite. What is not working and how we can go about fixing it. Finally, it is my conclusion that adults should use this time to really engage with digital technologies to learn what works and what does not. You just need to be mindful of what you are using your screen for. Dont feel gui

How Worried Should We Be About Screen Time During the Pandemic?

The coronavirus pandemic ended the screen time debate: Screens won. We all now find ourselves on our screens for school, for work and for connecting with family and friends during this time of social distancing and increased isolation.

But should we be worried about this excessive screen use right now? Or should we finally get over it and embrace the benefits of our digital devices?

---

In my opinion, we must embrace the increased use for the time being but still be cautious of our usage. We still need to keep a balance, just less of one right now since so much of our lives can be run from home using all the different communication devices and services. 
IOverall though,  think we should embrace the benefits of our digital devices and use them to their fullest.
 We must be very mindful of our children's but adults should probably try to be as productive as possible using these technologies. What is not working and how we can go about fixing it. Finally, it is my conclusion that adults should use this time to really engage with digital technologies to learn what works and what does not. You just need to be mindful of what you are using your screen for. Dont feel guilty either if you spend an extra hour or two playing games

How Worried Should We Be About Screen Time During the Pandemic?

The coronavirus pandemic ended the screen time debate: Screens won. We all now find ourselves on our screens for school, for work and for connecting with family and friends during this time of social distancing and increased isolation.

But should we be worried about this excessive screen use right now? Or should we finally get over it and embrace the benefits of our digital devices?

---

In my opinion, we must embrace the increased use for the time being but still be cautious of our usage. We still need to keep a balance, just less of one right now since so much of our lives can be run from home using all the different communication devices and services. 
IOverall though,  think we should embrace the benefits of our digital devices and use them to their fullest.

The coronavirus pandemic ended the screen time debate: Screens won. We all now find ourselves on our screens for school, for work and for connecting with family and friends during this time of social distancing and increased isolation.

But should we be worried about this excessive screen use right now? Or should we finally get over it and embrace the benefits of our digital devices?

---

In my opinion, we must embrace the increased use for the time being but still be cautious of our usage. We still need to keep a balance, just less of one right now since so much of our lives can be run from home using all the different communication devices and services. 
IOverall though,  think we should embrace the benefits of our digital devices and use them to their fullest.
 We must be very mindful of our children's but adults should probably try to be as productive as possible using these technologies. We just need to keep ourselves focused on our goals and limit our fun time if or when it starts to hurt our productivity and/or personal relationships. We should also be using this time to explore new digital tools and expand our skill sets. Screen time in one form or another will eventually become an all day even when we start using augmented reality  or virtual reality. So, we should be trying to learn as much as possible about these technologies now and how they can be used to improve our lives. We should also be paying attention to the opposite. What is not working and how we can go about fixing it. Finally, it is my conclusion that adults should use this time to really engage with digital technologies to learn what works and what does not. You just need to be mindful of what you are using your screen for. Dont feel guilty either if you spend an extra hour or two playing games or on social media every o

The coronavirus pandemic ended the screen time debate: Screens won. We all now find ourselves on our screens for school, for work and for connecting with family and friends during this time of social distancing and increased isolation.

But should we be worried about this excessive screen use right now? Or should we finally get over it and embrace the benefits of our digital devices?

---

In my opinion, we must embrace the increased use for the time being but still be cautious of our usage. We still need to keep a balance, just less of one right now since so much of our lives can be run from home using all the different communication devices and services. 
IOverall though,  think we should embrace the benefits of our digital devices and use them to their fullest.
 We must be very mindful of our children's but adults should probably try to be as productive as possible using these technologies. We just need to keep ourselves focused on our goals and limit our fun time if or when it starts to hurt our productivity and/or personal relationships. We should also be using this time to explore new digital tools and expand our skill sets. Screen time in one form or another will eventually become an all day even when we start using augmented reality  or virtual reality. So, we should be trying to learn as much as possible about these technologies now and how they can be used to improve our lives. We should also be paying attention to the opposite. What is not working and how we can go about fixing it. Finally, it is my conclusion that adults should use this time to really engage with digital technologies to learn what works and what does not. You just need to be mindful of what you are using your screen for. Dont feel guilty either if you spend an extra hour or two playing games or on social media every once in a great while but

How Worried Should We Be About Screen Time During the Pandemic?

The coronavirus pandemic ended the screen time debate: Screens won. We all now find ourselves on our screens for school, for work and for connecting with family and friends during this time of social distancing and increased isolation.

But should we be worried about this excessive screen use right now? Or should we finally get over it and embrace the benefits of our digital devices?

---

In my opinion, we must embrace the increased use for the time being but still be cautious of our usage. We still need to keep a balance, just less of one right now since so much of our lives can be run from home using all the different communication devices and services. 
IOverall though,  think we should embrace the benefits of our digital devices and use them to their fullest.

But should we be worried about this excessive screen use right now? Or should we finally get over it and embrace the benefits of our digital devices?

---

In my opinion, we must embrace the increased use for the time being but still be cautious of our usage. We still need to keep a balance, just less of one right now since so much of our lives can be run from home using all the different communication devices and services. 
IOverall though,  think we should embrace the benefits of our digital devices and use them to their fullest.
 We must be very mindful of our children's but adults should probably try to be as productive as possible using these technologies. We just need to keep ourselves focused on our goals and limit our fun time if or when it starts to hurt our productivity and/or personal relationships. We should also be using this time to explore new digital tools and expand our skill sets. Screen time in one form or another will eventually become an all day even when we start using augmented reality  or virtual reality. So, we should be trying to learn as much as possible about these technologies now and how they can be used to improve our lives. We should also be paying attention to the opposite. What is not working and how we can go about fixing it. Finally, it is my conclusion that adults should use this time to really engage with digital technologies to learn what works and what does not. You just need to be mindful of what you are using your screen for. Dont feel guilty either if you spend an extra hour or two playing games or on social media every once in a great while but as I suggested above, we need to focus more

IOverall though,  think we should embrace the benefits of our digital devices and use them to their fullest.
 We must be very mindful of our children's but adults should probably try to be as productive as possible using these technologies. We just need to keep ourselves focused on our goals and limit our fun time if or when it starts to hurt our productivity and/or personal relationships. We should also be using this time to explore new digital tools and expand our skill sets. Screen time in one form or another will eventually become an all day even when we start using augmented reality  or virtual reality. So, we should be trying to learn as much as possible about these technologies now and how they can be used to improve our lives. We should also be paying attention to the opposite. What is not working and how we can go about fixing it. Finally, it is my conclusion that adults should use this time to really engage with digital technologies to learn what works and what does not. You just need to be mindful of what you are using your screen for. How Worried Should We Be About Screen Time During the Pandemic?

The coronavirus pandemic ended the screen time debate: Screens won. We all now find ourselves on our screens for school, for work and for connecting with family and friends during this time of social distancing and increased isolation.

But should we be worried about this excessive screen use right now? Or should we finally get over it and embrace the benefits of our digital devices?

---

In my opinion, we must embrace the increased use for the time being but still be cautious of our usage. We still need to keep a balance, just less of one right now since so much of our lives can be run from home using all the different communication devices and services. 
IOverall though,  think we should embrace the benefits of our digital devices and use them to their fullest.
